intro: Bredemeyera densiflora var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth-flowered bredemeyera, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, glandular leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
